intro: Cienfuegosia junciformis var. ruyssenii, commonly known as the Ruyssen’s cienfuegosia, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, commonly known as grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in early spring, and it plays a minor but important role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
